greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of syllables in n in American English.
comment: Uses the convention of omitting a trailing 'and', so 101 is 'one hundred one' rather than 'one hundred and one.' - _Eric W. Weisstein_, May 11 2006
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: a(76)=4 because seventy-six is split sev.en.ty.six, or four syllables.
program: (PARI) A075774(n, t=[10^9, 2, 10^6, 2, 1000, 2, 100, 2])={ n>99 && forstep( i=1, #t, 2, n<t[i] && next; n=divrem(n, t[i]); return( A075774(n[1])+t[i+1]+if( n[2], A075774( n[2] )))); if( n<20, 1+!!setsearch(Set([0,7,13,14,15,16,18,19]),n) + 2*!!setsearch(Set([11,17]),n), 2+(n\10==7) + if(n%10, A075774(n%10)))}  \\ The "Set()" is not required in PARI v.2.6+ but we put it for downward compatibility. - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 03 2013
results.author: Ethan B. Trewhitt, Oct 09 2002
ext: More terms from _Eric W. Weisstein_, May 11 2006
